Blau <joe@atomize.xyz>","details":"Fenix is an ERC20 token that pays you to hold your own crypto.","events":{"Approval(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance."},"Transfer(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"burnXEN(uint256)":{"details":"Execute proof of burn on remote contract to burn XEN tokens","params":{"xen":"the amount of XEN to burn from the current wallet address"}},"calculateBonus(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Use fenix amount and term to calculate size and time bonus used for pool equity stake","params":{"fenix":"the amount of fenix used to calculate the equity stake","term":"the term of the stake in days used to calculate the pool equity stake"},"returns":{"_0":"bonus the bonus for pool equity stake"}},"calculateEarlyPayout((uint8,uint40,uint40,uint40,uint16,uint256,uint256,uint256))":{"details":"Calculates the early end stake penality to be split between the pool and the staker","params":{"stake":"the stake to calculate the penalty for"},"returns":{"_0":"reward the reward percentage for the stake"}},"calculateLatePayout((uint8,uint40,uint40,uint40,uint16,uint256,uint256,uint256))":{"details":"Calculates the late end stake penality to be split between the pool and the staker","params":{"stake":"a parameter just like in doxygen (must be followed by parameter name)"},"returns":{"_0":"reward the reward percentage for the stake"}},"calculateShares(uint256)":{"details":"Use bonus to calculate the number of shares to be issued to the staker","params":{"bonus":"the bonus to calculate the shares from"},"returns":{"_0":"shares the number of shares to be issued to the staker"}},"calculateSizeBonus(uint256)":{"details":"Use fenix amount to calculate the size bonus used for pool equity stake","params":{"fenix":"the amount of fenix used to calculate the equity stake"},"returns":{"_0":"bonus the size bonus for pool equity stake"}},"calculateTimeBonus(uint256)":{"details":"Use term to calculate the time bonus used for pool equity stake","params":{"term":"the term of the stake in days used to calculate the pool equity stake"},"returns":{"_0":"bonus the time bonus for pool equity stake"}},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"deferStake(uint256,address)":{"details":"Defer a stake by removing the supply allocated to the stake from the pool","params":{"stakeIndex":"the index of the stake to defer","stakerAddress":"the address of the stake owner that will be deferred"}},"endStake(uint256)":{"details":"End a stake by allocating the stake supply to the stakers wallet","params":{"stakeIndex":"the index of the stake to end"}},"flushRewardPool()":{"details":"Flush reward pool to stake pool"},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"onTokenBurned(address,uint256)":{"details":"Mint FENIX tokens to the user address","params":{"amount":"the amount of FENIX tokens to mint","user":"the address of the user to mint FENIX tokens for"}},"rewardCount()":{"details":"Read reward count from rewards array","returns":{"_0":"reward count"}},"rewardFor(uint256)":{"details":"Read reward from rewards array","params":{"index":"index of reward to read"},"returns":{"_0":"reward"}},"stakeCount(address)":{"details":"Read stake count from stakes mapping","params":{"stakerAddress":"address of stake owner"},"returns":{"_0":"stake count"}},"stakeFor(address,uint256)":{"details":"Read stake from stakes mapping stake array","params":{"stakeIndex":"index of stake to read","stakerAddress":"address of stake owner"},"returns":{"_0":"stake"}},"startStake(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Initialize a stake for the current wallet address","params":{"fenix":"the amount of fenix to stake","term":"the number of days to stake"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Evaluate if the contract supports burning tokens","params":{"interfaceId":"the interface to evaluate"}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`."}},"title":"FENIX pays you to hold your own crypto","version":1},"userdoc":{"errors":{"PRBMath_MulDiv18_Overflow(uint256,uint256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when the resultant value in {mulDiv18} devdoc.author: Joe Blau <joe@atomize.xyz>
devdoc.details: Fenix is an ERC20 token that pays you to hold your own crypto.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

burnXEN(uint256).details: Execute proof of burn on remote contract to burn XEN tokens

params.xen: the amount of XEN to burn from the current wallet address

calculateBonus(uint256,uint256).details: Use fenix amount and term to calculate size and time bonus used for pool equity stake

params.fenix: the amount of fenix used to calculate the equity stake
params.term: the term of the stake in days used to calculate the pool equity stake

returns._0: bonus the bonus for pool equity stake

calculateEarlyPayout((uint8,uint40,uint4.details: Calculates the early end stake penality to be split between the pool and the staker

params.stake: the stake to calculate the penalty for

returns._0: reward the reward percentage for the stake

calculateLatePayout((uint8,uint40,uint40.details: Calculates the late end stake penality to be split between the pool and the staker

params.stake: a parameter just like in doxygen (must be followed by parameter name)

returns._0: reward the reward percentage for the stake

calculateShares(uint256).details: Use bonus to calculate the number of shares to be issued to the staker

params.bonus: the bonus to calculate the shares from

returns._0: shares the number of shares to be issued to the staker

calculateSizeBonus(uint256).details: Use fenix amount to calculate the size bonus used for pool equity stake

params.fenix: the amount of fenix used to calculate the equity stake

returns._0: bonus the size bonus for pool equity stake

calculateTimeBonus(uint256).details: Use term to calculate the time bonus used for pool equity stake

params.term: the term of the stake in days used to calculate the pool equity stake

returns._0: bonus the time bonus for pool equity stake

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

deferStake(uint256,address).details: Defer a stake by removing the supply allocated to the stake from the pool

params.stakeIndex: the index of the stake to defer
params.stakerAddress: the address of the stake owner that will be deferred

endStake(uint256).details: End a stake by allocating the stake supply to the stakers wallet

params.stakeIndex: the index of the stake to end

flushRewardPool().details: Flush reward pool to stake pool

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

onTokenBurned(address,uint256).details: Mint FENIX tokens to the user address

params.amount: the amount of FENIX tokens to mint
params.user: the address of the user to mint FENIX tokens for

rewardCount().details: Read reward count from rewards array

stakeCount(address).details: Read stake count from stakes mapping

stakeFor(address,uint256).details: Read stake from stakes mapping stake array

startStake(uint256,uint256).details: Initialize a stake for the current wallet address

params.fenix: the amount of fenix to stake
params.term: the number of days to stake

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Evaluate if the contract supports burning tokens

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

devdoc.title: FENIX pays you to hold your own crypto

PRBMath_MulDiv18_Overflow(uint256,uint25.notice: Thrown when the resultant value in {mulDiv18} overflows uint256.

PRBMath_MulDiv_Overflow(uint256,uint256,.notice: Thrown when the resultant value in {mulDiv} overflows uint256.

PRBMath_UD60x18_Convert_Overflow(uint256.notice: Thrown when converting a basic integer to the fixed-point format overflows UD60x18.

PRBMath_UD60x18_Exp2_InputTooBig(uint256.notice: Thrown when taking the binary exponent of a base greater than 192e18.

PRBMath_UD60x18_Log_InputTooSmall(uint25.notice: Thrown when taking the logarithm of a number less than 1.

calculateEarlyPayout((uint8,uint40,uint4.notice: Calculate the early end stake penalty

calculateLatePayout((uint8,uint40,uint40.notice: Calculate the late end stake penalty

stakeFor(address,uint256).notice: Get stake for address at index

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Evaluate if the contract supports the interface

userdoc.notice: FENIX pays you to hold your own crypto
